body:
## Issue Description
Users need to go through a series of steps in order to have their account grandfathered to Login.gov.

## Initiative
We will zoom in on key moments across the user flow to develop content. We'll focus on moments that are critical and less well-defined by existing prototypes. These are:

 - [Create an IAL1 account: Step 1](https://app.mural.co/t/innovationboards1199/m/innovationboards1199/1671554156732/bb8f2948581f649bf8fd8ad9816224d93818992d?wid=414-1673385361809) when a Veteran sees a banner alerting them to the need to set up Login.gov
 - [Connect back to VA: Step 3](https://app.mural.co/t/innovationboards1199/m/innovationboards1199/1671554156732/bb8f2948581f649bf8fd8ad9816224d93818992d?wid=350-1673385361809) when a Veteran returns to the VA website they started from and is told that they now have a Login.gov account and should use it moving forward
 - [Upgrade to IAL2: Step 1](https://app.mural.co/t/innovationboards1199/m/innovationboards1199/1671554156732/bb8f2948581f649bf8fd8ad9816224d93818992d?wid=199-1673385361809) when a Veteran signs into a VA service in a future session and see a banner prompting them to upgrade to an IAL2 account
 - Add task for error state

body:
### Problem statement
Users need to go through a series of steps in order to have their account grandfathered to Login.gov.

### Initiative
We will look at 4 key moments across the user flow. We'll draft content and document initial thoughts on design (components to use from the VA design system). We'll focus on moments that are critical and less well-defined by existing prototypes. These are:
- [Asking a Veteran to set up a Login.gov IAL1 account after they sign in to a VA service](https://app.mural.co/t/innovationboards1199/m/innovationboards1199/1671554156732/bb8f2948581f649bf8fd8ad9816224d93818992d?wid=0-1674250041409)
- [Telling a Veteran they've set up a Login.gov (IAL1) account and they should use it moving forward](https://app.mural.co/t/innovationboards1199/m/innovationboards1199/1671554156732/bb8f2948581f649bf8fd8ad9816224d93818992d?wid=11-1674570924974)
- [Telling a Veteran that something went wrong](https://app.mural.co/t/innovationboards1199/m/innovationboards1199/1671554156732/bb8f2948581f649bf8fd8ad9816224d93818992d?wid=6-1674572901288)
- [Telling a Veteran they can upgrade their account to an IAL2 Login.gov account](https://app.mural.co/t/innovationboards1199/m/innovationboards1199/1671554156732/bb8f2948581f649bf8fd8ad9816224d93818992d?wid=4-1674571293449)

### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] All 4 states have been drafted in Mural and content has been reviewed by the VA content team

### Tasks
- [ ] @CarlDickerson draft language for all 4 states
- [ ] @MOStudioCarolyn @tygindraux review content
- [ ] @MOStudioCarolyn review which components are used for all 4 states (and pair with @CarlDickerson where necessary)
- [ ] @CarlDickerson share content for review at office hours or weekly sync with the content team
- [ ] @tygindraux create research ticket (in the backlog) for testing this full flow once we have a working prototype

## Welcome and Introduction
Welcome to the Veteran's Administration (VA) Veteran Facing Services (VFS) team! 
As a new VFS team member, you will be working in the web ecosystem we call the VA.gov Platform (or "**The Platform,**" for short).  The tasks on this list are designed to get you up to speed on the role of Platform, making it easier for you to do your job.

Because the VA is a huge organization that serves millions, the Platform it runs on is equally big, complex and multilayered. Most people find that even learning the basics for their own practice area entails a significant learning curve.  The tasks on this checklist will help you acquire those basics as quickly and efficiently as possible. 

## User Story
As a new VFS team member, I need to complete onboarding activities so I can successfully work on my project and support the VA.gov Platform.

body:
## Issue Description
The login.gov adoption team, stakeholders, and VA leadership don't have data surrounding counts of users currently logging in with DSLogon CSP. We need to gather data to provide a baseline of DS Logon credentials and analyze CSP counts and CSP methods to identify Veterans who will need to migrate from DSLogon.
IAM Data of User accounts SR-3634

## User Story
As a Product Owner
I want to know the total user counts by CSP accessing the va.gov ecosystem
So that we have a baseline of account totals to target for migration/grandfathering.

---
## Tasks
- [ ] Analyze data retrieved from IAM &Reconcile discrepancies in baseline data
- [ ] Work with Joe on authentication numbers to resolve VA data & IAM data 
- [ ] Double check interpretation of [ID.M](http://id.me/)E accounts (not shell/MFA-only) via IAM team
- [ ] # of identities: ask Joe whether we can get it on time, and what view it will be in 
- [ ] Proofing evidence for premium users with overlap: Get list of SEC IDs, highlight ~300k with overlapping, send to MHV
- [ ] Meet with IAM re: missing email data (from original service request). Get all for DSL & MHV. (Or Damian can pull via Tookit, if it's a small number.)Then analyze this new data. 
- [ ] Request Toolkit access

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Create a report of CSP counts and accepted baseline data.
---
title: Analyze data retrieved from IAM

body:
### Problem statement
Users with existing LOA2 credentials will be migrated to login.gov IAL1 accounts. When accessing the VA ecosystem they need to maintain current access permissions. 

### Initiative
We're working towards building a high-level flow that can define the organizational boundaries and requirements for different teams and partners as far as what needs to be built (to get grandfathering implemented).

### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] A high-level user flow for Veterans to migrate their accounts to Login.gov through grandfathering. (Binding)

### Tasks
- [x] Initial conversation with IAM to align on understanding of grandfathering
- [x] Create diagram
- [ ]  Finalize binding document
- [ ] Add documentation to github
- [ ] Review diagrams with Joe & other stakeholders (with experience on consuming IAM binding service) 
- [ ] Prioritize with IAM (John: Work with IAM/Danny to prioritize grandfathering development work)
- [ ] Get Ksenia access to AWS (Request has been made)
- [ ] Get apps running & deploy locally (@holytoastr)
- [ ] Get Melissa access to AWS
- [ ] Get Melissa SOCKS proxy access
title: High-level user flows for grandfathering solution

body:
### Problem statement
Users need to go through a series of steps in order to migrate their account to Login.gov through a grandfathering approach. This will happen from different entry points.

### Initiative
We will create a shared working document in Mural. The document will help define the different user flows needed for a Veteran to migrate to Login.gov through grandfathering.

### Acceptance criteria
- [x] A set of defined, potential user flows for Veterans to migrate their accounts to Login.gov through grandfathering

### Tasks
- [x] @tygindraux: Create shared [Mural board](https://app.mural.co/t/innovationboards1199/m/innovationboards1199/1671554156732/bb8f2948581f649bf8fd8ad9816224d93818992d?sender=u397f6dbbaed1b5b67b956658)
- [x] @tygindraux @sdickson-gt: Initial conversation to align on understanding of grandfathering
- [x] @tygindraux: Sketch initial flows, including user interaction and existing design status
- [x] @tygindraux: Share initial flows with @sdickson-gt for feedback
- [x] @tygindraux: Updates to flows based on feedback
- [x] @tygindraux: Share at mid-sprint review for feedback from PO
- [x] @tygindraux @sdickson-gt: Consider additional or missing user flows eg. fail pathways
title: Define potential user flows for grandfathering

body:
## User Story
As a VFS team member who just completed a discovery research initiative, I need to present my findings and proposed solutions to OCC so that OCC has an opportunity to provide input and/or prioritize the proposed solutions.

## Description
Prepare and present to OCC on Jan 12 at 1-2pm EST. Focus on research with users (across all 4 themes) and update on where we are currently.

Update from John on 4 January: 'For presentations, make it clear we're starting with migration and DSL. We're not going to be able to address NVUR in the immediate term, which OCC won't be stoked about. We need to take the right steps first. Add decision points details and steps we're taking towards messaging (organic, direct outreach, give an idea on times for those strategies). Make it clear that we understand there are lots of stakeholders, and that part of our strategy is outreach and coordination with partners. Through presentations like this, but also other coordination around dependencies, the identity working group sessions, etc.'

John Rahaghi, Anthony and Tyler to attend.

## Tasks
- [x] Create slide deck
- [x] Update slick deck for specific meeting
- [x] Check in with John to confirm what he'd like shared
- [x] Add updates based on John's comments
- [x] Prepare for presentation

## Acceptance Criteria
- [x]  We have presented our research findings and proposed solutions to OCC on Jan 12 at 1-2 pm EST.
title: Prepare presentation for OCC Jan 12 at 1-2pm EST

body:
### Problem Statement

The Login.gov Adoption team does not have a communication strategy in place for legacy CSP migrations and DS Logon sunset.

### Initiative: 
Develop communication strategy with VEO, MHV, and eBen
- Straw-man Conceptual
- Review initial Communication suggestions paths

Creating a customized plan with each team to identify messaging, timelines, and anticipated outcomes proactively helps all team members prepare for deployment.
Communicating the anticipated changes (the 5 W’s) and the benefits to consumers and Veterans, will demonstrate transparency and collaboration amongst the community.

### Acceptance Criteria:
- [ ] A clear communications strategy is developed.
- [ ] VEO, MHV, and eBen have reviewed and provided feedback on the strategy.

body:
## Issue Description
The login.gov adoption team, stakeholders, and VA leadership don't have a way to easily view the information surrounding VA identity and access methods and key metrics.

We need to gather data to provide a baseline of DS Logon credentials and develop metrics to measure against

## User Story
As a Product Owner
I want to present information about our authentications and unique user counts
So that other stakeholders can easily access this information

---

## Tasks
- [x] Obtain necessary access permission in datadog
- [ ] Design dashboard in datadog to display access methods/account details which contains:
- Unique users for ID.me, Login.gov, MHV, DSL
- Authentication counts for ID.me, Login.gov, MHV, DSL
- New account creation counts for ID.me, Login.gov, MHV, DSL
- [ ] Work with Joe from Identity to establish [baselines dashboard](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/issues/51678) for inherited proofing appropriately verified credentials.
title: Design baseline data dashboards

## Recommended Collaboration Cycle touchpoints 

### Design Intent
<details open>

#### Before meeting
  
##### VFS actions
- Navigate to reference link: [Design Intent Guidance](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/collaboration-cycle/design-intent)
- [ ] Schedule your Design Intent when ready:
   - Open the [Calendly design intent calendar](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/design-intent-or-midpoint-review)
   - Select a date and time and click “Confirm”
   - Add your name and email
   - Click "Add Guests" and enter the VFS meeting attendees email addresses
      - Invite all relevant VFS team members, including accessibility support, product owners, and other VA stakeholders 
   - Click "Schedule Event"
- [ ] Notify the Collaboration Cycle team of this event with scheduled date/time in #vfs-platform-support ([see Slack Workflow User guide](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/support/Getting-help-from-the-Platform-in-Slack.1439138197.html))
- [ ] Link all artifacts **ONLY** in the Design Intent artifacts section below at least two days before the scheduled Design Intent.  **Do NOT add artifacts to Comments section**
  
**Design Intent artifacts**

- [ ] Whiteboard sketch or other lo-fi prototypes or wireframes
- [ ] User flow
- [ ] Research plan
- [ ] Any other artifacts you have so far
  
##### Platform actions
- [ ] Follow Moderator Responsibilities guidance for Design Intent
- [ ] Meeting date/time:
  
#### After meeting
  
##### Platform actions

  - [ ] Accessibility has completed the review
  - [ ] Design has completed the review
  - [ ] IA has completed the review
- [ ] Update this ticket with the Zoom recording
  - Recording URL:

##### VFS actions

body:
## User Story
As a VFS team member who just completed a discovery research initiative, I need to present my findings and proposed solutions to login.gov so that they have an opportunity to provide input and/or prioritize the proposed solutions.

## Description
Note: This meeting has been rescheduled by Login.gov. It will now be on January 24 at 12pm. We have 30 minutes to present.

Prepare and present to Login.gov All Hands meeting on January 10. Focus on research with users and findings related to adoption, security keys and in-person proofing and support (less focus on NVUR).

Update from John on 4 January: 'For presentations, make it clear we're starting with migration and DSL. We're not going to be able to address NVUR in the immediate term, which OCC won't be stoked about. We need to take the right steps first. Add decision points details and steps we're taking towards messaging (organic, direct outreach, give an idea on times for those strategies). Make it clear that we understand there are lots of stakeholders, and that part of our strategy is outreach and coordination with partners. Through presentations like this, but also other coordination around dependencies, the identity working group sessions, etc.'

Tyler to present. Attended by team (depending on availability).

## Tasks
- [x] Create [slide deck](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1bBgVXutZToULgvQR05RdQSxU2DQWADqW/edit#slide=id.p1)
- [x] Update slick deck for specific meeting
- [x] Check in with John to confirm what he'd like shared
- [x] Add updates based on John's comments
- [x] Prepare for presentation

## Acceptance Criteria
- [x] We have presented our research findings and proposed solutions to Login.gov on January 24
title: Prepare presentation for Login.gov on January 24 (12:15pm)

body:
## Issue Description
The login.gov adoption team, stakeholders, and VA leadership don't have a way to easily view the information surrounding VA identity and access methods and key metrics. 

Potential metrics to track:
- number of existing accounts by cred
- Number of sign ins by week and month
- Proofed/not proofed
- Migration segments (target number for inherited proofing, grandfathering, other)
- Number of new accounts being created for all creds
- Track direct email comms (open rates, bouncebacks, correlate to inherited proofing / grandfather flow or other directions)

## High Level User Story/ies
As a VA stakeholder, I need visibility into login metrics so I can track login.gov adoption progress.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Key metrics are able to be seen on a dashboard

## Hypothesis or Bet
By providing a dashboard that enables stakeholders to visualize key metrics, stakeholders will have better insight into the progress of the login.gov adoption, help identify where improvements need to be made, and will be able to make better decisions to address any gaps.

## We will know we're done when... ("Definition of Done")
*What requirements does this project need to meet for you to finish this initiative?*
- [ ] Critical login CSP metrics are identified and exposed through dashboard
- [ ] We have identified and created a data set for obtaining metrics

## Known Blockers/Dependencies 
*List any blockers or dependencies for this work to be completed*
- Subject matter expertise in Domo and/or DataDog
- Training from Analytics and Insights Team
- Data from IAM 

## Projected Launch Date
Q1 2023

*Take into consideration Accessibility/QA needs as well as Product, Technical, and Design requirements.*
title: Create login.gov adoption dashboard to track key metrics

body: Create IAL2-prompting communication plan for IAL1 users. Determine if definitive timeline is needed to 'upgrade' to an IAL2 account.
title: IAL2 Promotion Plan

body: Provide clarity to users on their account level, IAL1, with an easy opportunity to proof (remote/in-person) at any time. Post banner on ongoing basis of current risks & encourage promoting.
title: IAL1 technical and design considerations within VA ecosystem

body: Determine if permissible to allow IAL1 credentialed veterans to accept security risk and retain full access to all VA services.
title: IAL1 Risk Acceptance Plan

body: Identify eligible veterans via IAM-shared data based on method in which they proofed and evaluate lower/higher risk scenarios.
title: Identify eligible Veterans

body: Evaluate UX and design considerations if IAL1 Login.gov users can log into other government services (e.g., SSN) with their account.
title: IAL1 consideration for other government services, beyond VA

body: Update Help desk training materials for reactivation of MHV accounts w/ Login.gov flow
title: MHV account reactivation training w/ Login.gov flow

body:
Design a user flow, including interactions and content, that directs a user to set up a Login.gov credential if or when DS Logon or My HealtheVet are down or unavailable.

Considerations:
- how the flow is triggered
- steps in the journey
- a clear call-to-action that describes the outage or sunset
title: Design a user flow for when DS Logon or My HealtheVet have a service outage that direct a user to set up a Login.gov credential

body:
Create a count down clock that shows when different login credentials will be sunset, so that users are aware of the upcoming change.

Considerations:
- where the clock is shown
- when the clock goes up (and down)
- how to communicate two different login sunsets at once
title: Count down clock ahead of DS Logon sunsets

body:
Identify Veterans who will need to migrate from DSLogon and communicate directly on the preferred channel.

Comms needs:

- Options for migrating
- Deadline
- Why it's happening
title: Communication plan for DS Logon sunsetting

body: Determine which VA accounts use DS Logon credentials, and among them which are eligible for inherited/grandfathering vs. those who will need to re-proof (informs targeted communications strategy).
title: User segmentation for paths of migration

body:
A space where the VA can answer questions posted by Veterans, respond to issues, and be more proactive/responsive to Veteran conversations.

Post the most up-to-date info on credential updates across security, MFA, access to new/other government services.

Link to relevant help resources internal and at Login.gov.

Authenticated view: Consider personalization to Veteran based on where they live—proofing locations if needed (USPS) or VA in-person help options
title: Public-facing VA webpage for all things Login.gov

body:
Leverage data around user segmentation for paths of migration to curate targeted communication.

Consideration:
- DS Logon users (who among them are eligible for inherited/grandfathering vs. those who aren't)
title: Targeted communications based on segmentation and likely path of migration

body:
Leverage the dedicated, hands-on support that Veterans organically provide to fellow Veterans.

Create shareable content for Veteran use / sharing, eg.,:

- Step-by-step set-up instructions with pictures
- Troubleshooting content easily sharable
- Creating 'talking points' for Veterans who want to help a fellow Veteran

Secondary benefit of materials for VA employees who help Veterans more frequently.
title: Shareable materials about Login.gov for peer-to-peer interactions (and MHV coordinator, VSO, TAP)

body:
Craft campaign messaging to enlist Veteran-sympathetic or serving orgs to help Veterans. The campaign will focus on the necessity of migration and the training/resources they can expect.

Craft and communicate training material for the to-be-enlisted supporting orgs.
  
*Will need to adjust as  functionality changes (absence of DS logon, new options added, etc.)
title: Create campaign to enlist support from Veteran-sympathetic orgs

body:
Explore alternate angles that explain the "why" behind Login.gov—and how their adoption of a new CSP is important:
- Educate on changes to security landscape: Craft & post IAL2 is federal mandate & why.
- Inform Veterans of reduced VA spending with CSP consolidation: Craft & post reduced cost waste by VA in reducing no. of CSPs.
- Communicate Duty of Veterans to protect fellow Veterans Data: Potential approach of framing way in which base watch standers are req'd to check ID and those requesting access must provide specific credentials to gain access
title: A/B test comms messaging to reach a variety of Veteran audiences

body: The VA should utilize traditional and non-traditional methods of education/awareness to help users understand the future of security, and why security standards are evolving and should be a priority. It's more than just preventing someone from stealing your identity. Education methods can include informal moments like facebook reels or social media that feel relatable.
title: Direct, simple, educational messaging on why security is an evolving priority

body:
Craft a plan to eventually exclude non-preferred login methods
- Make Login.gov the default option with credential fields already present and other credential options only visible when actively selected
- A timeline to determine sequentiality of login option eliminations

Considerations:
- Review other services successfully using Login.gov
- Review other services with only 1-2 login options
title: Remove (DS Logon) and deprioritize (MHV) less preferred sign in options for all VA services - Use the power of the default

body:
Where possible auto-populate required information for account creation based on information the Veteran has previously provided to the VA.

The user still needs to input information for proofing or engage in in-person proofing.
title: Enable Login.gov to auto-fill Veteran details for login.gov account creation
Chatbot intercept at moment of abandonment or repeated error states
Surface the option to get in-person help from Step 1 of Login.gov account creation—not just after failure to upload credential
Alt Login.gov landing page (and adjustment to flow) for those who have proactively proofed during a VHIC appoint
Build process proposals for Login.gov proofing bundling
Create integration with VA/Login.gov to create a shell account for individuals who have opted in during VHIC proofing
Equip Veterans with the necessary provisions to accomplish VA TAP objectives
Eliminate opportunities for failed Login.gov adoption during TAP days
Utilize the TAP roster pre- & post-TAP classes to ensure Login.gov adoption
Centralized training for those who support users & the Login.gov flow
Increase interagency communication when planning TAP schedule
User research to test remote video ID-proofing workflows.

body: Meet Veterans where they are, literally. Establish a pop-up vehicle that can travel to community events—or maybe even Veterans in rural communities to bring in-person help to them.
title: Mobile support vehicle for Veterans: We'll come to you

body:
UX and design considerations to prompt Veterans to schedule in-person help for transition.

*Dependent in-person support being up & running

*Dependent on scheduling functionality

*Dependent on technical assessment (assume this will require jSON work to pull & show schedule availability by office & staff).
title: Prompt the Veterans who have not migrated to a Login.gov account to schedule in-person support
Leverage community events to drive additional outreach and support
Enable MHV coordinators to verify and record Veteran IDs for Login.gov ID proofing
Update the Chatbot manual to support Veterans using Login.gov

body:
In addition to help Login.gov can provide Veterans, the VA should provide hands-on support with Login.gov set up and use. We should designate or create dedicated roles within the VA who support Veterans with Login.gov

Considerations:
- collaboration with Login.gov, and how these roles would differ from support Login.gov can provide Veterans
- workflows, training and other materials these VA roles would need
- Visibility into Login.gov process
title: Designate or create dedicated Login.gov support roles in the VA

body:
To help My HealtheVet coordinators facilitate support with Login.gov, we will establish a direct point(s) of contact at Login.gov.

Considerations:
- collaboration with Login.gov
- how this might scale beyond My HealtheVet, for example, to play out across other benefit programs
title: Establish a direct point of contact at Login.gov for VA My HealtheVet Coordinators

body:
We should gather and then design content that shows where a Veteran can get help when they're setting up Login.gov. This might look like an easy to navigate contact or resource list, including the general VA helpline. We can custom VA targeted help pages from Login.gov.

Considerations:
- gathering and organizing contact list, designing flows and content, throughout different journeys
- collaboration with Login.gov
- touch-points like the current contact page and and Ask VA
title: Design content that tells a user where to get help throughout the Login.gov set up
Conduct in-person security key research with less digitally-connected users.
Remind Veterans to set up a back up MFA option
Help me set up a good password
In-person user research to understand how less digitally-connected users use and set up MFA.
Let Veterans set up some of their account and save what they need help with for later
Allow users to not need a password (or remove them)
Use doctors and other networks to suggest shared access to Veterans and caregivers
Allow Veterans to easily invite proxies to access their information
Proactively reach out to Veterans about setting up proxy access based on life events
Allow Veterans to monitor proxy access and activity on their behalf
Allow Veterans to grant tiered access to their VA information
Allow Veterans to grant proxy access to all of their VA services, not just MHV
Build VA-wide alignment on the definition of proxy access and on needed features

## Description
We need to write a content brief so we're clear on the purpose of the blog (to raise awareness of Login.gov) and can work with or support the VEO. The blog will be posted on the [VA blog](https://news.va.gov/).

The VEO (Veterans Experience Office) will help us shape this content using the VA content approach, and we'll be able to pull what we need from it (or at least that's what we think right now). Our meeting with the VEO is on Wednesday, 30 November.

## User Story
As a Veteran, I need to understand what Login.gov and its benefits, so that I know why I should set up Login.gov as my primary or additional credential.
As a Veteran, I need to understand how to set up Login.gov, so that I can try and set up Login.gov on my own terms.
As a Veteran, I need to know where to go for help if I face an issue while setting up Login.gov, so that I can finish setting up Login.gov.

## Description
We need to do research with VA TAP coordinators in order to understand their perspectives on what happens during TAP and the best ways to introduce proactive Login.gov account creation during this key moment in a Veterans journey.

This was identified by John Rahaghi as a priority.

## User story/ies
As a TAP coordinator, I need to offboard service members with information, services and support, so that they are informed Veterans as they leave the military.

## Definition of done
Research with users (TAP coordinators) is planned, facilitated and done. We have insights to support how to move forward with support or guidance for staff to help Veterans proactively set up Login.gov and understand what updates to the curriculum we would need to suggest (if any).

## Flags
This task requires further definition in order to understand the objectives of the study more closely. Also, we won’t have access to the newest TAP curriculum until January 2023, and this will help us shape the study.

body:
## Description
During [Login.gov Adoption discovery research](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/tree/master/products/identity-product-team/research/discovery) we weren’t able to recruit users with low technology use or skills. We’ve identified a gap in our knowledge to understand how users who are less digitally-connected interact with multi-factor authentication.

If they have used multi-factor authentication before, we need to understand the issues they’ve faced with set up or use; and if they have not used it before, we need to understand the issues they may encounter with set up or use.

We’ve specifically identified one use-case: how unhoused Veterans use MFA. We know that MFA use can prohibit them, in particular, from using online systems because they may be accessing accounts on shared systems, like a library computer, without an additional device. We hypothesize that security keys could be a MFA method that supports them. 

John Rahaghi identified this as a priority.

## User story/ies
As a less digitally connected Veteran, I need to be able to set up and use multi-factor authentication, so that I can use Login.gov to access VA services.
As an unhoused Veteran, I need to be able to set up and use multi-factor authentication when I use a public or shared device, so that I can use Login.gov to access VA services.

## Definition of done
Research with users is planned, facilitated and done. We have insights to support how to move forward with supporting users with low technically-savvy skills when they set up and use MFA.

## Flags
This task requires access to a specific-set of users which we need to recruit for an in-person study; and we know that Perigean does not have many of these participants in their network.

## Tasks
- [ ] Scope research objectives, method and recruitment critera
- [ ] Create conversation guides, prototypes or other stimuli for research
- [ ] Submit research for review ([Platform Collaboration Cycle](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/research-design/research-checklist#ResearchChecklist-7.Shareyourfindingswithcolleagues))
- [ ] Recruit participants
- [ ] Run a pilot ([Platform Collaboration Cycle](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/research-design/research-checklist#ResearchChecklist-7.Shareyourfindingswithcolleagues))
- [ ] Conduct sessions
- [ ] Synthesize insights
- [ ] Write up findings ([Platform Collaboration Cycle](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/research-design/research-checklist#ResearchChecklist-7.Shareyourfindingswithcolleagues))
- [ ] Share at VA weekly Design + Content + Research meeting ([Platform Collaboration Cycle](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/research-design/research-checklist#ResearchChecklist-7.Shareyourfindingswithcolleagues))
title: In-person user research to understand how less digitally-connected users use and set up MFA

## Welcome and Introduction
Welcome to the Veteran's Administration (VA) Veteran Facing Services (VFS) team! 
As a new VFS team member, you will be working in the web ecosystem we call the VA.gov Platform (or "**The Platform,**" for short).  The tasks on this list are designed to get you up to speed on the role of Platform, making it easier for you to do your job.

Because the VA is a huge organization that serves millions, the Platform it runs on is equally big, complex and multilayered. Most people find that even learning the basics for their own practice area entails a significant learning curve.  The tasks on this checklist will help you acquire those basics as quickly and efficiently as possible. 

## User Story
As a new VFS team member, I need to complete onboarding activities so I can successfully work on my project and support the VA.gov Platform.

## Product Outline
### Areas of Opportunity
-- [Mural Link](https://app.mural.co/t/innovationboards1199/m/innovationboards1199/1666809748438/cb7646f7601ecf52a5b2d5fc336f7f33a03ca5e9?sender=u427c689a272f3045eebc8117) -- 

### Veteran Facing
**Increased proactive communication**
- Promote signing up for Login.gov pre-TAP
- Explain MHV login requirements
- Outline privacy standards to address concerns heading into TAP
**Pre-work** 
- Assign readings/activities pre-TAP so Veterans come prepared to complete Login.gov signup
**Increased access to various modalities**
- Required one-on-one if Veteran doesn’t have Login.gov by EOD
**In-person proofing available on TAP days** 
**Equipment provision**
- Notebook to track account credentials
- Kiosks or computers for class sessions
**Resource Guide to reference** 
discussed resources

### VA Facing
**Centralized training for those who support users & credentials** 
- Benefits Advisors, VSOs, MHV Coordinators
**Utilizing TAP roster pre- & post-outreach**
- Targeted approach to introduce Login.gov & make account in advance 
- Check who does and does not have Login.gov account by end of TAP days
- Post-TAP follow up
**Interagency communications**
- Course content, TAP day order, login portal use
**Modality analysis**
- With the eventual goal to sunset, less effective modality

### Curriculum Specific >> see image below
- Visual guides & step-by-step
- Eliminate “tech” jargon in instructions
- Have physical examples when appropriate (security keys)
- Snackable, easy to digest info
- Add specifics & examples (ex. acceptable IDs, agencies that use Login.gov) 
- Mobile-friendly & accessibility-focused 
- web design 
- Standardized task format: timeline/expectations, players involved, instructions, reason/benefit, point of contact
![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/63273ef24d9dd10610cc51db/a77846d7-ab85-42e1-b9f6-16a1485ddc39)

## High Level User Story/ies
As a _____, I need _____ so I can _____.

## Hypothesis or Bet
**If** _we make this change_ **then** _we expect this to happen_.

## OKR
_Which Objective / Key Result does this epic push forward?_

## Definition of done
The TAP curriculum is out-of-date when it comes to login for VA services and benefits. It should be updated to remove DS Logon and encourage users to use Login.gov from the start. This area has unknowns, a lack of contact points and relationships, and a lack of general knowledge.
**Revisit in Jan 2023 once updated curriculum is released**
![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/63273ef24d9dd10610cc51db/1c2fb489-9c8e-4e39-bcd3-2445c33279fb)

body:
## Product Outline

Part of the process of logging into login.gov is to undergo MFA. Currently, only one MFA is **required** albeit it is recommended to use two. This epic is to allow a user to opt-out of MFA entirely, knowing the security risks posed by such action. 

### Scenario 1
**Task 6**: MFA >> pivot to opt-out of MFA >> https://www.figma.com/file/nAlLYv1GLIpB9KMavdZKq0/VA-Identity-Research?node-id=101%3A230
- Upgrade to Login.gov process
- Integration with applications
- New account state with MFA Opt-out >> to ensure any application tied recognizes and is used in compliance with their own security standards

## High Level User Story/ies
As a user, I want to opt-out of login.gov MFA, so I can quickly gain access to MHV or other application.
- User recognizes that this will make their account less secure

## Hypothesis or Bet
**If** _we make this change_ **then** _we expect this to happen_.

## OKR
_Which Objective / Key Result does this epic push forward?_

## Definition of done
### What must be true in order for you to consider this epic complete?

body:
## Welcome and Introduction
Welcome to the Veteran's Administration (VA) Veteran Facing Services (VFS) team! 
As a new VFS team member, you will be working in the web ecosystem we call the VA.gov Platform (or "**The Platform,**" for short).  The tasks on this list are designed to get you up to speed on the role of Platform, making it easier for you to do your job.

Because the VA is a huge organization that serves millions, the Platform it runs on is equally big, complex and multilayered. Most people find that even learning the basics for their own practice area entails a significant learning curve.  The tasks on this checklist will help you acquire those basics as quickly and efficiently as possible. 

## User Story
As a new VFS team member, I need to complete onboarding activities so I can successfully work on my project and support the VA.gov Platform.

## How to fill out this ticket
- [x] Add your name to the ticket title

- [x] Under **Get set up for your practice area,** you only need to complete the items for your role

body:
## Product Outline

This feature gives you the option to set-up limited or full access to your account for anyone who you want. 
- Person will be able to create their own account with their own email and password and access as much of your information as you want them to
- User can change or remove their access at any time

**Location:** Post MHV Login
- _Premium_ Account

**Integrations:**
- MPI >> profile data
- Login.gov >>

**Scenario 2:** Deferred Migration
- Task #9 >> https://www.figma.com/file/nAlLYv1GLIpB9KMavdZKq0/VA-Identity-Research?node-id=152%3A169
- Task #10 Email reminder >> https://www.figma.com/file/nAlLYv1GLIpB9KMavdZKq0/VA-Identity-Research?node-id=152%3A238
> If you want to make any changes it gives you a link to update. The email also asks you to think about anyone you might have shared your user name and password with. If any of those people should no longer have access to your account it suggests you change your password and provides a link to do that as well.
 >>


## High Level User Story/ies
As a user, I want to be able to give others differing levels of access to my MHV account, so I can empower them to provide greater care and support to me.

## Hypothesis or Bet
**If** _we make this change_ **then** _we expect this to happen_.
- Usefulness of feature
- Who they would share with and what information or level of access
- How they describe someone (language they use)


## Definition of done
### What must be true in order for you to consider this epic complete? 
**Collected Inputs**
- First Name
- Last Name
- Email
- Relationship to you (drop-down)
- Type of information you want to grant access (drop-down)

Submission leads to appointment of access levels and auto-outreach to the designated person with new access

**Access Levels:**
- Limited 
- Full

```
Submission >> send an auto-email to specified person at their corresponding email address
- What are the next steps?
```

*Take into consideration Accessibility/QA needs as well as Product, Technical, and Design requirements.*

- [ ] **Labeled with Practice Area** (`backend`, `frontend`, `devops`, `design`, `research`, `product`, `ia`, `qa`, `analytics`, `contact center`, `research`, `accessibility`, `content`)

We need to do further research to understand how users who are less digitally-connected interact with MFA.

If they have used MFA before, we need to understand issues they’ve faced with set up or use; and if they've not used it before, we need to understand the issues they may encounter. 

In particular, this research needs to include unhoused Veterans.

## Product Outline
**Scenario 2**: As you might know, security keys are small devices like this [show security key] that can either be plugged into a computer or held close to a smart phone and act as the secondary confirmation so you don’t have to type anything in after your email and password.

**Task 3: MULTI-FACTOR AUTHENTICATION**
https://www.figma.com/file/nAlLYv1GLIpB9KMavdZKq0/VA-Identity-Research?node-id=152%3A33

## High Level User Story/ies
_As a user, I need the option for security keys (provided by the VA or otherwise), so I can MFA for login.gov._

## Hypothesis or Bet
**If** _we make this change_ **then** _we expect this to happen_.

- After going through those steps, did your perception about security keys change at all?

- Do you think you would need help to set up or use a security key? Who would you get help from?

**Things to watch for:**
- Confusion
- What they find useful or confusing (if anything) on the screen
- Which option they find most secure and why

## OKR
_Which Objective / Key Result does this epic push forward?_

## Definition of done
### What must be true in order for you to consider this epic complete? 

*Take into consideration Accessibility/QA needs as well as Product, Technical, and Design requirements.*

body:
## Product Outline

**Scenario 2:** Deferred Migration
- Task 7: CHECK IN FOR APPOINTMENT & ID PROOF. _When you arrive at your appointment and check-in, the nurse at the desk says, “I see that we could confirm your ID for your Login.gov account today. Would you like to do that now?”_
**Scenario 1:** Migration >> https://www.figma.com/file/nAlLYv1GLIpB9KMavdZKq0/VA-Identity-Research?node-id=101%3A228
- Task 3 Information Gathering for login.gov (name, SSN, birthdate and phone number)
- Task 4 EMAIL AND PASSWORD SET UP
- Task 5 ID Proofing
**SCenario 3:** Proactive
- Task 3: Information gathering. The internal VA Employee system can ingest the information previously collected for VHIC card (name, SSN and birthdate) >> https://www.figma.com/file/nAlLYv1GLIpB9KMavdZKq0/VA-Identity-Research?node-id=152%3A267

**Ability to ingest the following inputs:**
- Name
- SSN
- DOB
- Email (inputted by user)
- Phone
- Password (inputted by user)


**Integrations:**
- Automated Message Platform (email or mail)
- Appointment System
- Check-in System
- Login.gov (client-facing)

## High Level User Story/ies

As a VA Employee...

**I need an internal login.gov platform to be able to:**
- Assist with ID verification (for login.gov)
- Be aware of upcoming user visit appointments, their desired objectives, and eligible options for greater access
- 

**So I can:**
- Help users proof their login.gov
- Provide better visit experience via preparation

## Hypothesis or Bet
**If** _we make this change_ **then** _we expect this to happen_.
- If ID verifying at the next VA visit feels like a burden or a convenience
- Difficulty finding or having ID with them
- Concerns about sharing ID


## OKR
_Which Objective / Key Result does this epic push forward?_
**N/A**

body:
There is an opportunity to bind an LOA2 VA credentials to Login.gov IAL1 so it can at least be used within VA without requiring initial additional identity proofing. The end goal is to simplify the migration process for existing users.

## Product Outline
[Link](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/tree/master/products/login.gov-adoption/products/legacy%20CSP%20migrations)

## High Level User Story/ies
**As a** user of government services
**I want** to utilize a modern, secure credential
**So that** I can safely access government services

# User Experience
## Acceptance Criteria (Eligible User)
- [ ] On login, check user for eligibility
- [ ] If user is eligible account is flagged as Eligible
- [ ] On next login, user is presented a [page/modal] indicating eligibility and can proceed or decline
- [ ] On decline, user is taken back to previous location
- [ ] On accept, user is presented with page explaining what will happen
- [ ] User is taken to Login.gov to create/sign-in with their account
- [ ] User is returned to VA.gov on a page explaining they have now linked their Login.gov account
- [ ] If user tries to login with legacy credentials later, they are prompted to use Login.gov

# Technical
## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All tasks in Frontend Epic completed
- [ ] All tasks in Backend Epic completed
- [ ] All tasks in Security Epic completed
- [ ] DAST Scan

Currently there are no VA-wide agreed upon definition of these users or clarity on their use cases and needed levels of access. These individuals will need the ability to identity proof in person at VA facilities.

Because the VA is a huge organization that serves millions, the Platform it runs on is equally big, complex and multilayered. body:
[Research folder](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/tree/master/products/login.gov-adoption/research/discovery)

## Summary

There are currently multiple ways to sign in and access My HealtheVet and other VA services. These login options don’t all meet the required security standards and also create frustration and confusion for users.

Through our research, we hoped to explore how the VA can most successfully migrate existing users, and onboard new user to Login.gov (which is a compliant, single sign-on credentialing platform). While Login.gov does currently exist, our research hopes to uncover the best ways to support Veterans, non-Veteran roles, and VA staff in this transition.

We want to understand:
* how we can intervene to ensure that new generations of Veterans use Login.gov or ID.me to access My HealtheVet from the start.
* what in-person support will enable Veterans to create and use a Login.gov account to access My HealtheVet.
* how the greatest number of Veterans can use multi-factor authentication options, including security keys.
* how setting up and maintaining shared access might work for Veterans and non-Veterans.

## Key findings

1. Setting up a new credential is frustrating for Veterans if it's made to seem like a choice or the need is unclear.
2. Knowing humanized and dedicated support is available, motivates Veterans to setup and use a credential.
3. Being identity proofed at another appointment, and, as the start or end to account setup, is more convenient for Veterans
4. Veterans see security as the VA’s responsibility, but are motivated to be more careful if it puts their benefits access at risk, or they understand how their actions affect fellow Veterans.
5. Perceived ease of use and complex views on security inform Veterans' multi-factor authentication choices.
6. Veterans will choose whichever login credential is most familiar, or, seems more direct to complete a task.
7. Veterans don't think to share access to their healthcare information until life altering events make it necessary.

More on key findings in this [Research Findings](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/products/login.gov-adoption/research/discovery/login.gov%20adoption%20discovery%20research%20findings.md) document.

## Welcome and Introduction
Welcome to the Veteran's Administration (VA) Veteran Facing Services (VFS) team! 
As a new VFS team member, you will be working in the web ecosystem we call the VA.gov Platform (or "**The Platform,**" for short).  The tasks on this list are designed to get you up to speed on the role of Platform, making it easier for you to do your job.

Because the VA is a huge organization that serves millions, the Platform it runs on is equally big, complex and multilayered. Most people find that even learning the basics for their own practice area entails a significant learning curve.  The tasks on this checklist will help you acquire those basics as quickly and efficiently as possible. 

## User Story

Welcome to the Veteran's Administration (VA) Veteran Facing Services (VFS) team! 
As a new VFS team member, you will be working in the web ecosystem we call the VA.gov Platform (or "**The Platform,**" for short).  The tasks on this list are designed to get you up to speed on the role of Platform, making it easier for you to do your job.

Because the VA is a huge organization that serves millions, the Platform it runs on is equally big, complex and multilayered. ## Welcome and Introduction
Welcome to the Veteran's Administration (VA) Veteran Facing Services (VFS) team! 
As a new VFS team member, you will be working in the web ecosystem we call the VA.gov Platform (or "**The Platform,**" for short).  The tasks on this list are designed to get you up to speed on the role of Platform, making it easier for you to do your job.

Because the VA is a huge organization that serves millions, the Platform it runs on is equally big, complex and multilayered. Most people find that even learning the basics for their own practice area entails a significant learning curve.  The tasks on this checklist will help you acquire those basics as quickly and efficiently as possible. 

## User Story
As a new VFS team member, I need to complete onboarding activities so I can successfully work on my project and support the VA.gov Platform.

Welcome to the Veteran's Administration (VA) Veteran Facing Services (VFS) team! 
As a new VFS team member, you will be working in the web ecosystem we call the VA.gov Platform (or "**The Platform,**" for short).  The tasks on this list are designed to get you up to speed on the role of Platform, making it easier for you to do your job.

Because the VA is a huge organization that serves millions, the Platform it runs on is equally big, complex and multilayered. body:
## Welcome and Introduction
We are excited to welcome your team to VA.gov. As a new VFS team, this template should be completed by your teams Product Owner and/or Product Manager. 

## User Stories
As the leader of a new VFS team, I need to share basic info about my team with Platform so that Platform teams can have knowledge of my team for future collaboration.

As the leader of a new VFS team, I need to ensure my team follows the instructions for new VFS team members so that they're aware of Platform policies and processes, and Platform is aware of who supports my team for future collaboration.

As the leader of a new VFS team, I need to ensure my teams product information is correct so that Platform can have an accurate list of VA.gov products.

As the leader of a new VFS team, I need to complete ATO orientation so that VA.gov continues to be a secured and approved application within the VA. 


## New Team Info
Add your team's practice and contact information below.

- **Team Name:** login.gov adoption

- **OCTO-DE Product Owner:** John Rahaghi

- **VA Business Owner:**
   - [x] OCTO (Office of the CTO)
   - [ ] VHA (Veterans Health Administration)
   - [ ] VBA (Veterans Benefits Administration)
   - [ ] NCA (National Cemetery Administration)
   - [ ] VACO (Veterans Affairs Central Office)
   - [ ] Other. Please specify: ____________

- **Crew:**
   - [ ] Sitewide
   - [x] Account Experience
   - [ ] Health Tools
   - [ ] Benefit Tools
   - [ ] Lighthouse API

- **Github team label:** login.gov-adoption
 
- **Team launch date:** 8/18/22
 
- **Public slack channel:** #va-identity-product-team
 
- **Other team names:**

- [x] This information has been added.

## Platform Orientation for your team members
In addition to providing information to Platform and completing necessary tasks at the team level, there are also tasks that need to be completed at the individual level. As a team leader, you will need to: 
- [x] Direct your team members to the guidance for [New VFS team members](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/getting-started/Guidance-for-new-teams-and-team-members.2132803700.html#Guidancefornewteamsandteammembers-NewVFSTeammembers) on Platform Website
- [x] Ask all of your team members to complete the process

## Review and update your team's product information 
- [ ] Go to the [VA Product Directory](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/getting-started/vfs-product-directory)
- [ ] Navigate to and select your team's product
- [ ] Review to make sure that all of your team's products are listed and assigned correctly
- [ ] If an edit to your team's product page needs to be made, see the [user guide](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/getting-started/vfs-product-directory-user-guide)

## ATO (Authorization to Operate) orientation
- [ ] Reach out to Faith Owusu-Sekyere on Slack
- [ ] Request and schedule an ATO team orientation
- [ ] Confirm that the orientation has been completed


## Platform Checklist
The items in this checklist are for Platform to complete. If you are ready to close the ticket and the Platform Checklist section has not been completed, please reach out to Platform via the guidance provided in [Getting help from Platform in Slack](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/support/Getting-help-from-the-Platform-in-Slack.1439138197.html).
- [x] New VFS Team has been added to the [VFS Team Roster](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11dpCJjhs007uC6CWJI6djy3OAvjB8rHB65m0Yj8HXIw/edit?folder=0ALlyxurHpUilUk9PVA#gid=0)

- [x] Review the [Guidelines for Working Safely in an Open Source Repo](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/working-with-vsp/policies-work-norms/sensitive-guidance.md)
- [x] Review the [Norms for Using Tools](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/working-with-vsp/policies-work-norms/norms-tools.md)

### Working on the platform
- [x] Review the [Platform Principles](https://vfs.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/AP/pages/1391853669/Platform+Crew+Principles)
- [x] Review the [GitHub Markdown Cheatsheet](https://help.github.com/en/categories/writing-on-github) to learn the syntax for formatting documents in GitHub
- [x] Review the [Digital Modernization Strategy](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/products/va-gov-relaunch-2018/va-gov-strategy/digitalmodernizationstrategy.pdf)
- [x] Review the [Web Brand Consolidation](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/products/va-gov-relaunch-2018/va-gov-strategy/the-new-va.gov-briefing-2019-07.pdf) documentation
- [x] Review the [Collaboration Cycle](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/collaboration-cycle/index.html) documentation on Platform Website
- [x] Review the [Collaboration Point Tracker](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1OgPyEvUlNF6EnaYMFAXJkV6FKOvZnlPnbOQ2fAJ7W7A/edit#gid=1116695886)

### Get set up for your practice area
#### Designers & Researchers
- [x] Review [Design & Research Onboarding Documentation](https://design.va.gov/documentation/designers)
- [x] Review the [VA.gov Design System](https://design.va.gov/)
- [x] Review the [Research and Design Guide](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/research-design/index.html) on Platform Website
- [x] Attend Design orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/design-orientation-for-va-gov-platform))
- [x] Attend Accessibility orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/accessibility-orientation-for-va-gov-platform))

#### Front-end Engineers
- [ ] Review [frontend developer documentation](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/developer-docs/Frontend-developer-documentation.687931428.html) on Platform Website
- [ ] [Confirm that You Can Log In as a Test User](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team-sensitive/blob/master/Administrative/accessing-staging.md)
- [ ] Attend Front-end orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/front-end-orientation-for-va-gov-platform))
- [ ] Attend Analytics orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/analytics-orientation-for-va-gov-platform))
- [ ] Attend Accessibility orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/accessibility-orientation-for-va-gov-platform))
- [ ] Attend QA orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/qa-orientation-for-va-gov-platform))

#### Back-end Engineers
- [ ] Review [backend developer documentation](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/developer-docs/Backend-developer-documentation.1886289964.html) on Platform Website
- [ ] [Confirm that You Can Log In as a Test User](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team-sensitive/blob/master/Administrative/accessing-staging.md)
- [ ] Attend Back-end orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/back-end-orientation-for-va-gov-platform))
- [ ] Attend QA orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/qa-orientation-for-va-gov-platform))

#### Product Managers
- [ ] Request PM intro with @ Shira Goodman in Slack
- [ ] Attend Analytics orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/analytics-orientation-for-va-gov-platform))
- [ ] Attend Accessibility orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/accessibility-orientation-for-va-gov-platform))
- [ ] Attend QA orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/qa-orientation-for-va-gov-platform))

### Off-boarding of teammates
- [x] Review [process for when a teammate leaves](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/working-with-vsp/contractoroffboarding.md)


## Platform Checklist
The items in this checklist are for Platform to complete. If you are ready to close the ticket and the Platform Checklist section has not been completed, please reach out to Platform via the guidance provided in [Getting help from Platform in Slack](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/support/Getting-help-from-the-Platform-in-Slack.1439138197.html).
- [x] New VFS Team member has been added to the [VFS Team Roster](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/11dpCJjhs007uC6CWJI6djy3OAvjB8rHB65m0Yj8HXIw/edit?folder=0ALlyxurHpUilUk9PVA#gid=0)

CC: @department-of-veterans-affairs/vsp-product-support
title: Platform Orientation Template [Carolyn Alyssa Williams]

body:
## User Story
As a new VA.gov team member, I need to complete onboarding activities so I can successfully work on my project.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Each team member has completed each item in the orientation checklist below.

## Onboarding Checklist


- [x] Attend General Orientation meeting ([schedule via Calendly](https://calendly.com/collaboration-cycle/general-orientation-for-va-gov-platform?month=2021-11))
- [x] Review [Orientation materials](https://depo-platform-documentation.scrollhelp.site/getting-started/Platform-Orientation.1877344532.html) on Platform Website
- [x] [Request Access to Tools](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/working-with-vsp/orientation/request-access-to-tools.md)
- [x] Review the [Guidelines for Working Safely in an Open Source Repo](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/working-with-vsp/policies-work-norms/sensitive-guidance.md)
- [x] Review the [Norms for Using Tools](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/working-with-vsp/policies-work-norms/norms-tools.md)
- [x] Review the [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/working-with-vsp/policies-work-norms/code-of-conduct.md)
- [x] Review the [Platform Principles](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/working-with-vsp/policies-work-norms/platform-principles.md)
- [x] Review the [Norms for Communication](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/working-with-vsp/policies-work-norms/norms-communication.md)
- [x] Review the [GitHub Markdown Cheatsheet](https://help.github.com/en/categories/writing-on-github) to learn the syntax for formatting documents in GitHub
- [x] Review the [Digital Modernization Strategy](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/products/va-gov-relaunch-2018/va-gov-strategy/digitalmodernizationstrategy.pdf)
- [x] Review the [Web Brand Consolidation](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/products/va-gov-relaunch-2018/va-gov-strategy/the-new-va.gov-briefing-2019-07.pdf) documentation
- [x] Review the [Collaboration Cycle](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/tree/master/platform/working-with-vsp/vsp-collaboration-cycle) documentation
- [x] Review the [Collaboration Point Tracker](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1d219oL1zCvCvnv1Bx-dI-GMzwgbarLv9_bzMSa3ULjA/edit#gid=1341642809)
- [x] Sign up for the [Platform Newsletter](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/platform-newsletter/README.md)
- [x] Watch [VA.gov overview video](https://youtu.be/0cc-VdfI4Q8)
- [x] [Process for when a teammate leaves](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/working-with-vsp/contractoroffboarding.md)
- [x] Designers: Review [Design & Research Onboarding Documentation](https://design.va.gov/documentation/designers)

  - [x] [Confirm that You Can Log In as a Test User](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team-sensitive/blob/master/Administrative/accessing-staging.md)
  - [x] [Set up internal tools](https://github.com/department-of-veterans-affairs/va.gov-team/blob/master/platform/working-with-vsp/orientation/request-access-to-tools.md)
- [ ] Designers: Request design orientation with @ Allison Christman in Slack


## Notes:
To track the work needed to complete the items in this checklist, you may want to create GitHub issues. 
- [ ] Assign the issues to individual(s) to complete
- [ ] Label the issues appropriately ( `orientation`, `[your-team-name]`)
- [ ] Attach the issues to this Epic
title: VA Platform Orientation-Carl
